title: [Large-scale] 3D Virtual Reality-based Chemistry Molecular Structure and Reaction Exploration Program

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level general chemistry knowledge (atomic structure, chemical bonding, understanding of basic reaction equations) and experience with simple experimental observations
context.additional_context: Visualizing chemistry concepts via smartphone-based 3D desktop virtual reality, including experimental design and data analysis activities to strengthen scientific inquiry skills. Emphasizes improving learning outcomes through enhanced spatial perception and self-efficacy, optimized for linking microscopic molecular observations with macroscopic reaction phenomena.

learning_goals: Accurately identify chemical molecular structures in a 3D virtual reality environment and explain the scientific inquiry process.
Recreate chemical reaction processes through simulation using spatial perception skills, analyze variables, and derive conclusions.
Achieve 80%+ performance accuracy in solving chemistry problems based on self-efficacy and systematically analyze experimental data.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
